p: In addition, seven species displayed an increase in their future distributions after area gain was accounted for in models, with an estimated area gain ranging from 22 to 74 km 2/year. These seven species (i.e., Caesalpinia glabrata, Coccoloba ruiziana, Colicodendron scabridum, Cordia macrantha, Guazuma ulmifolia, Handroanthus chrysanthus, and Prosopis juliflora) also showed corresponding increases in their total edge lengths and number of patches, assuming recolonization.
